class_notes:
This is a course offered in fulfillment of the reading and writing requirement, since the students in an advanced level of a language should gain proficiency not only in reading different kinds and styles of the language they are learning, but also in analyzing what they have read and heard, followed by responding in writing with their own ideas.
Throughout the course, students become familiar with different styles of Persian writing, from prose to poetry and from fiction to non-fiction, including extracts from books and newspapers on various subjects, as well as clips from audio/ visual media. Students write weekly response papers conveying their impressions or ideas about the subjects and material read/ listened.  Their writing is read and discussed in class (helping to learn through the successes/errors of others), and they are then asked to rewrite and expand their essays with attention to style, grammar and vocabulary.  These exercises help them to better comprehend the different kinds of written and oral texts, and to learn the skill of writing proficiently in Persian.
course_description: Prerequisites: Persian 301 or permission of instructor. Continuation of Persian 301.
